page.title: 02Lydlinch Village 1
page.content:
Blink twice and you have missed the village which is either side of half a mile of the A357.The village is approached from the east by crossing the{River Lydden,}marking the boundary between Bagber and Lydlinch,via an 18th-century stone bridge.This is one of several in the county bearing a warning plaque which states that
" ANY PERSON WILFULLY INJURING ANY PART OF THIS COUNTY BRIDGE WILL BE GUILTY OF FELONY AND UPON CONVICTION LIABLE TO BE TRANSPORTED FOR LIFE BY THE COURT T.FOOKS "
To help preserve the bridge, an ungainly metal bailey bridge has been erected alongside it taking the traffic travelling eastwards.
